alert.note: Alert for Gove; Greeley; Logan; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued December 01 at 3:24AM CST until December 02 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Fire Weather Watch Issued For Portions of West Kansas... .A combination of warm temperatures, low RH values and windy conditions will lead to critical fire weather conditions Friday. Gusty westerly winds will be present across the watch area before shifting to the NW behind a cold front; winds will become stronger behind the cold front potentially gusting up to 60 mph. Blowing dust may be possible during the afternoon with perhaps a wall of dust along the cold front. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 027, 028, 029, 041, AND 042... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Friday morning through Friday afternoon. * Affected Area...In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 027 Wallace, Fire Weather Zone 028 Logan, Fire Weather Zone 029 Gove, Fire Weather Zone 041 Greeley and Fire Weather Zone 042 Wichita. * Winds...Westerly 15-20 mph gusting up to 30 mph becoming Northwest 30 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * Relative Humidity...Mid to upper teens. * Temperatures...Around 70. * Impacts...Any fires that start may exhibit explosive fire growth. Outdoor burning is not advised. The wind shift may create dangerous fire conditions if one were to be ongoing. Blowing dust may obscure vision of any fire.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
